suggestions.reason: Won by Submission is the terminal state for all successful submissions including Armbar from Guard.
This is the starting position for the kneebar technique and should be referenced in the setup requirements.
RNC Defense is specifically about defending against the Rear Naked Choke submission, making this the primary offensive technique being countered.
Scarf Hold (Kesa Gatame) is a variation of side control and shares similar control principles and pressure mechanics.
S-Mount is a submission-focused position optimized for finishing attacks, making the terminal submission state highly relevant.
The Knee Cut Position is directly created by executing the Knee Cut Pass technique, making this a critical transition-to-position relationship.
Headquarters is fundamentally a guard passing position, making guard pass concepts directly applicable.
Guard retention is the core defensive skill that Guard Recovery System addresses when guard has been compromised but not fully passed.
Body Triangle Back Control is a specific application of triangle mechanics applied to back control, making this a fundamental related position.
Frame creation is a fundamental concept explicitly mentioned in defensive positioning and essential for maintaining defensive structure.
Float passing is a transitional position that methodically advances toward side control as the primary completion target.
Essential defensive concept for maintaining half guard when under passing pressure.
Knee shield variations are fundamentally defensive guard retention positions that manage distance and prevent passing pressure.
Bottom Turtle is the defensive perspective of Turtle Position, making this the most directly related page for understanding both sides of this position.
Deep Half Guard Top is the inverse position of Half Guard Bottom, and understanding the bottom player's perspective is essential for defending and passing.
Explicitly mentioned in schema as 'Technical Stand-up Sweep' transition from X-Guard to Top Position.
Knee on Belly is a quintessential pressure-based control position, making pressure application concepts directly relevant to understanding and maximizing its effectiveness.
Core defensive technique for maintaining bottom position and preventing opponent from passing guard.
Spider Guard Bottom is a guard retention system that heavily relies on guard retention principles to maintain distance and control.
Inverted Guard is an advanced guard retention technique, making this a fundamental conceptual link for understanding why inversion is used defensively.
Lasso variations require advanced guard retention principles to maintain control during dynamic movements and inversions.

instructions.task: Apply these wikilink suggestions to markdown files
reporting: Report line numbers where links added
